subject: IGCSE Mathematics

overview.description: Cambridge IGCSE Mathematics curriculum designed to develop mathematical skills, understanding, and reasoning capabilities for students pursuing international qualifications and global university pathways

learning_objectives: Master core mathematical concepts required for IGCSE certification
Develop problem-solving skills using mathematical techniques
Apply mathematics to real-world contexts and situations
Prepare for further study in mathematics and related subjects
Develop mathematical communication and reasoning skills

units.title: Number and Algebra
learning_outcomes: Master operations with integers, fractions, decimals, and percentages
Solve linear and quadratic equations and inequalities
Work with indices, surds, and algebraic expressions
Apply number and algebra skills to practical problems

lessons.title: Quadratic Equations and Problem Solving
objectives: Solve quadratic equations using factorization, completing the square, and quadratic formula
Apply quadratic equations to real-world problems
Understand the graphical representation of quadratic functions

activities.description: Compare different methods for solving quadratic equations
Solve real-world problems involving quadratic equations
Analyze quadratic functions using graphing technology
Practice IGCSE-style questions and mark schemes

cross_curricular_connections: Physics: Projectile motion and parabolic paths
Economics: Profit maximization and cost functions

units.title: Geometry and Trigonometry
learning_outcomes: Calculate areas, volumes, and surface areas of shapes and solids
Use trigonometric ratios to solve problems
Apply Pythagoras' theorem and trigonometry in three dimensions

lessons.title: Trigonometry in Real-World Applications
objectives: Apply trigonometric ratios to solve practical problems
Use sine and cosine rules in triangle problems
Calculate heights, distances, and angles in real contexts

activities.description: Measure heights and distances using trigonometry in school grounds
Solve navigation and bearing problems using trigonometry
Apply trigonometry to engineering and construction scenarios
Use calculators and apps for trigonometric calculations

resources: Maps and compass for navigation problems

units.title: Statistics and Probability
learning_outcomes: Collect, organize, and display statistical data
Calculate and interpret measures of central tendency and dispersion
Apply statistical methods to real-world data analysis

lessons.title: Statistical Analysis of Real Data Sets
objectives: Analyze real statistical data from various sources
Create appropriate statistical displays and interpretations

activities.description: Collect primary data through surveys or experiments
Analyze data using statistical software and calculators
Present statistical findings with appropriate interpretations
Critically evaluate statistical claims and presentations

cross_curricular_connections: Global Perspectives: Social and economic statistics

units.title: Functions and Graphs
learning_outcomes: Understand and work with various types of functions
Sketch and interpret graphs of functions
Apply transformations to functions and graphs
Solve problems involving functions in practical contexts

lessons.title: Function Transformations and Real-World Modeling
objectives: Apply transformations to functions and their graphs
Model real-world situations using various function types
Interpret function behavior in practical contexts

activities.description: Explore function transformations using graphing technology
Model real-world situations using appropriate functions
Interpret function graphs in practical contexts
Develop strategies for IGCSE function questions

resources: IGCSE past papers and mark schemes
cross_curricular_connections: Physics: Mathematical modeling of physical phenomena

assessment_objectives: AO1: Recall, select and use knowledge of mathematical facts
AO2: Use mathematical skills and techniques
AO3: Apply mathematical skills in various contexts
AO4: Reason, interpret and communicate mathematically
examination_structure: Paper 2: Calculator allowed (1 hour 30 minutes, 50% weighting)
Paper 3: Calculator allowed (1 hour 30 minutes, 20% weighting)

formative_assessments: Weekly problem-solving tasks aligned with IGCSE standards
Progressive topic tests using past paper questions
Peer assessment and collaborative problem solving

textbooks: IGCSE Mathematics Past Papers and Mark Schemes

university_preparation.mathematics_requirements: Strong foundation for A-level Mathematics and Further Mathematics
university_preparation.science_programs: Mathematical skills for physics, chemistry, and engineering
university_preparation.international_recognition: Globally recognized qualification for university admission
